alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:03PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Converse County through 845 PM MDT... At 801 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Teapot Rock, or 28 miles northeast of Casper, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Converse County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for east central Wyoming.
